title: Arson attacks target France’s trains hours before Olympics, officials say
content: France condemned coordinated “acts of sabotage” on high-speed rail lines, which caused mass disruptions before the Opening Ceremonies of the Paris Olympic Games.
summary: France condemned coordinated “acts of sabotage” on high-speed rail lines, which caused mass disruptions before the Opening Ceremonies of the Paris Olympic Games.

title: Russia wary of U.S. and France election surprises, especially Kamala Harris
content: Harris, largely unknown to the Russians, is viewed with alarm.
summary: Harris, largely unknown to the Russians, is viewed with alarm.

title: Olympics quiz: Pick the right anthems, flags and avoid a diplomatic incident
content: Previous Olympics have played the wrong national anthems, or displayed the wrong flags - angering players and supporters. Can you do any better?
summary: Previous Olympics have played the wrong national anthems, or displayed the wrong flags - angering players and supporters. Can you do any better?

title: From ‘sunny ways’ to cloudy days: Canadians have tired of Justin Trudeau
content: The charismatic son of former Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau has won three elections and rescued the Liberal Party from irrelevance. Now voters want change.
summary: The charismatic son of former Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau has won three elections and rescued the Liberal Party from irrelevance. Now voters want change.

title: How one Chinese machine tool maker is helping Russia’s war against Ukraine
content: NATO has accused Beijing of being a “decisive enabler” of Moscow’s ongoing war. The case of Oree Laser, now sanctioned by the U.S., shows how China is helping Russia.
summary: NATO has accused Beijing of being a “decisive enabler” of Moscow’s ongoing war. The case of Oree Laser, now sanctioned by the U.S., shows how China is helping Russia.

title: Top Sinaloa cartel leader taken into U.S. custody alongside son of  ‘El Chapo’
content: Ismael “El Mayo” Zambada was fooled into boarding a U.S.-bound private plane with Joaquin Guzmán, El Chapo’s son, who was also detained, a DHS official said.
summary: Ismael “El Mayo” Zambada was fooled into boarding a U.S.-bound private plane with Joaquin Guzmán, El Chapo’s son, who was also detained, a DHS official said.

title: Is this the beginning of the end for the Maduro regime in Venezuela?
content: After a decade of economic calamity and political repression, Venezuela stands on the brink of once-unfathomable change: Maduro may lose the presidency by a landslide.
summary: After a decade of economic calamity and political repression, Venezuela stands on the brink of once-unfathomable change: Maduro may lose the presidency by a landslide.

title: Harris calls for cease-fire and hostage release after Netanyahu meeting
content: The White House is trying to pressure the Israeli prime minister to accept terms of a cease-fire and hostage-release deal.
summary: The White House is trying to pressure the Israeli prime minister to accept terms of a cease-fire and hostage-release deal.

title: How Paris made the city the stage for the 2024 Olympics
content: Instead of building new stadiums, Paris is embedding Olympic events in the French capital and hoping to highlight its history and green transformation.
summary: Instead of building new stadiums, Paris is embedding Olympic events in the French capital and hoping to highlight its history and green transformation.

title: New U.K. state company to develop offshore wind on seabed owned by Charles III
content: The Crown Estate, the monarchy’s real estate firm, owns much of the seabed surrounding Britain.
summary: The Crown Estate, the monarchy’s real estate firm, owns much of the seabed surrounding Britain.

title: Divers discover 19th-century shipwreck laden with 100 champagne bottles
content: Any plan to pop the corks will have to wait until further exploration, the team said.
summary: Any plan to pop the corks will have to wait until further exploration, the team said.

title: Israel recovers bodies of five hostages amid delay in latest talks on deal
content: Israeli media contrasted the news about the recovery of the bodies with Benjamin Netanyahu’s triumphant speech in the United States and the lack of a hostage deal.
summary: Israeli media contrasted the news about the recovery of the bodies with Benjamin Netanyahu’s triumphant speech in the United States and the lack of a hostage deal.

title: NORAD intercepts Russian, Chinese bombers off Alaskan coast
content: Defense officials have noted increased China-Russia cooperation in the Arctic, while cautioning that their collaboration is still “somewhat superficial.”
summary: Defense officials have noted increased China-Russia cooperation in the Arctic, while cautioning that their collaboration is still “somewhat superficial.”

title: Russia is banned from the Paris Olympics. Here’s what that means.
content: Russia is banned from the Paris Olympics, but its athletes aren’t. Instead, they’ll be competing as Individual Neutral Athletes, without their country’s flags.
summary: Russia is banned from the Paris Olympics, but its athletes aren’t. Instead, they’ll be competing as Individual Neutral Athletes, without their country’s flags.

title: Wildfire reaches resort town of Jasper as Alberta battles over 170 blazes
content: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said “every necessary resource available” was being mobilized as wildfires rage across the western Canadian province.
summary: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said “every necessary resource available” was being mobilized as wildfires rage across the western Canadian province.

title: The ordinary people risking everything to protect Venezuela’s vote
content: In a country where the authoritarian president is accused of rigging elections — disqualifying challengers, barring international observers, harassing opponents, menacing voters — their work could prove essential.
summary: In a country where the authoritarian president is accused of rigging elections — disqualifying challengers, barring international observers, harassing opponents, menacing voters — their work could prove essential.

title: Sanctions crushed Syria’s elite. So they built a zombie economy fueled by drugs.
content: A U.S.-led sanctions campaign aimed to force Syria’s brutal leaders to step aside. A multibillion-dollar illicit drug industry arose to preserve their grip on power.
summary: A U.S.-led sanctions campaign aimed to force Syria’s brutal leaders to step aside. A multibillion-dollar illicit drug industry arose to preserve their grip on power.

title: Komodo dragons have iron-coated teeth to rip apart prey, scientists find
content: The study’s lead author said it provided insight into how the lizards keep their teeth razor sharp — and possible clues to how dinosaurs like Tyrannosaurus rex hunted.
summary: The study’s lead author said it provided insight into how the lizards keep their teeth razor sharp — and possible clues to how dinosaurs like Tyrannosaurus rex hunted.

title: As Netanyahu hails Gaza war effort, hobbled Hamas government clings to power
content: As law and order collapse in Gaza, Hamas has retained pockets of power and has been quick to reemerge in areas where Israeli forces have withdrawn.
summary: As law and order collapse in Gaza, Hamas has retained pockets of power and has been quick to reemerge in areas where Israeli forces have withdrawn.

title: Twice-a-year shot provides 100 percent HIV protection, study finds
content: None of the 5,000 women and girls in South Africa and Uganda who received the shots contracted the virus that causes AIDS, a study shows. A trial for men is underway.
summary: None of the 5,000 women and girls in South Africa and Uganda who received the shots contracted the virus that causes AIDS, a study shows. A trial for men is underway.

title: Netanyahu dismisses critics, scolds protesters in defiant speech to Congress
content: Evoking Israel’s sworn enemy Iran, Benjamin Netanyahu told Congress his nation’s campaign against Hamas in Gaza is part of a broader fight against “barbarism.”
summary: Evoking Israel’s sworn enemy Iran, Benjamin Netanyahu told Congress his nation’s campaign against Hamas in Gaza is part of a broader fight against “barbarism.”

title: Anti-Israel protests and threats set tone for politically charged Olympics
content: The Israeli soccer team took the field in Paris on Wednesday in one of the first events of an extremely tense Summer Olympics.
summary: The Israeli soccer team took the field in Paris on Wednesday in one of the first events of an extremely tense Summer Olympics.

title: U.K. royals to get big raise as Crown Estate sees record $1.4 billion profit
content: The Crown Estate’s profits more than doubled in the past year, partly due to lucrative offshore wind farm leases on land owned by the monarchy, meaning a windfall for them and the government.
summary: The Crown Estate’s profits more than doubled in the past year, partly due to lucrative offshore wind farm leases on land owned by the monarchy, meaning a windfall for them and the government.

title: North Korean balloon drops trash on South Korean presidential office
content: The airborne garbage delivery was the latest, and perhaps most humiliating, episode in the ongoing trash-offensive.
summary: The airborne garbage delivery was the latest, and perhaps most humiliating, episode in the ongoing trash-offensive.

title: Netanyahu’s history of clashing with U.S. presidents spans decades
content: As Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu meets with President Biden in Washington on Thursday, here is a look back at some of his most notable clashes with U.S. presidents.
summary: As Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu meets with President Biden in Washington on Thursday, here is a look back at some of his most notable clashes with U.S. presidents.

title: 1972 Munich Olympics, marred by killing of Israeli athletes, loom over Paris Games
content: The 2024 Paris Olympics begin this weekend amid the global fallout over the Oct. 7 attacks on Israel by Hamas and the Gaza war.
summary: The 2024 Paris Olympics begin this weekend amid the global fallout over the Oct. 7 attacks on Israel by Hamas and the Gaza war.

title: American reality show contestant kills, eats protected bird in New Zealand
content: Spencer “Corry” Jones apologized after killing a weka, a large flightless bird with “a famously feisty and curious personality,” on “Race to Survive: New Zealand.”
summary: Spencer “Corry” Jones apologized after killing a weka, a large flightless bird with “a famously feisty and curious personality,” on “Race to Survive: New Zealand.”
